dataset_id: MOPITT Beta Derived CO (Near and Thermal Infrared Radiances) V107
title: MOPITT Beta Derived CO (Near and Thermal Infrared Radiances) V107
summary: MOP02J.107 is the Measurements Of Pollution In The Troposphere (MOPITT) Level 2 MOPITT Beta Derived CO (Near and Thermal Infrared Radiances) Version 107 product. It is an unvalidated beta product subject to recalibration and consists of the geolocated, retrieved carbon monoxide profiles and total column amounts for carbon monoxide. Ancillary data concerning surface properties and cloud conditions at the locations of the retrieved parameters are also included. Each retrieval is accompanied by an estimated error. Measurements Of Pollution In The Troposphere (MOPITT) was successfully launched into sun-synchronous polar orbit aboard Terra, NASA's first Earth Observing System spacecraft on December 18, 1999. The MOPITT instrument was constructed by a consortium of Canadian companies and funded by the Space Science Division of the Canadian Space Agency.Ancillary data concerning surface properties and cloud conditions at the locations of the retrieved parameters are also included. Each retrieval is accompanied by an estimated error. Version 107 products are beta versions for version 7 products, they are unvalidated beta products subject to recalibration.
